abstract: California Gov Jerry Brown and Democrats in state's Senate drop measure that would create 50 percent cut in California's petroleum use by 2030; death of bill, most ambitious part of series of legislation and regulations by state in effort to curb greenhouse gas emissions, is hard-fought victory for oil industry, which had asserted among its claims that mandate could lead to ban on sport utility vehicles in state.
lead_paragraph: Opponents, in dealing a major setback to environmentalists, had warned that the percent mandate would result in higher fuel and electricity costs.

headline.main: California Democrats Drop Plan for 50 Percent Oil Cut
headline.print_headline: California Democrats Drop Plan for 50 Percent Oil Cut

snippet: Opponents, in dealing a major setback to environmentalists, had warned that the percent mandate would result in higher fuel and electricity costs.
